title: Race and gender in Ringgold Who's Afraid . . .

content.description: Who's Afraid of Aunt Jemima © Faith Ringgold 1983
content.question:
The work shown is the story quilt Who’s Afraid of Aunt Jemima? (1983) by Faith Ringgold.

Analyze how the artist’s choices of imagery and medium address the social issues of race and gender.

frqParts.text:

topic.text: 10.2: Purpose and Audience in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art) beyond the image set, including-  a. form.  b.  Style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
